La bohÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨me is an opera in four acts by Giacomo Puccini to an Italian libretto by
Luigi Illica and Giuseppe Giacosa, based on ScÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨nes de la vie de bohÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨me by Henri
Murger. The world premiere performance of La bohÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨me was in Turin on 1 February
1896 at the Teatro Regio and conducted by the young Arturo Toscanini. Since then
La bohÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¨me has become part of the standard Italian opera repertory and is one of
the most frequently performed operas internationally. <a href="
